trans-unit.source: Represents a Windows control that displays a frame around a group of controls with an optional caption.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> displays a frame around a group of controls with or without a caption.
Use a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> to logically group a collection of controls on a form.
The group box is a container control that can be used to define groups of controls.
The typical use for a group box is to contain a logical group of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls.
If you have two group boxes, each of which contain several option buttons (also known as radio buttons), each group of buttons is mutually exclusive, setting one option value per group.

You can add controls to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Controls%2A> property.
Only controls that are contained within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control can be selected or receive focus.
The complete <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> itself cannot be selected or receive focus.

For more information about how this control responds to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A> methods, see the following <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> members: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CanFocus%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CanSelect%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focused%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ContainsFocus%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> cannot display a scroll bar.
If you need a control similar to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> that can contain a scroll bar, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> class.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.TabStop%2A> property is set to `false` when a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> is created.
The group box has an initial height of 100 pixels and width of 200 pixels.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control will allow drag-and-drop operations and events to be used.
`true` to allow drag-and-drop operations and events to be used; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> resizes based on its contents.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> automatically resizes based on its contents; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.AutoSize"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets how the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> behaves when its <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.AutoSize"></xref> property is enabled.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode.GrowOnly"></xref>.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control.
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref>.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A> property is referenced.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref>.
Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> structure that contains the default padding settings for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control.
The default padding indicates the padding on each side of the control is three pixels.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> with all its edges set to three pixels.
Gets the default size of the control.
The default <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the control.
Gets a rectangle that represents the dimensions of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> with the dimensions of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref>.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control.
Gets or sets the flat style appearance of the group box control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.FlatStyle%2A> value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.System> does not receive mouse events.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.Standard"></xref>.
The value assigned is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle"></xref> values.
Occurs when the user presses a key while the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control has focus.
Because a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control cannot get focus, this event is never raised.
Occurs when the user presses a key while the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control has focus.
Because a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control cannot get focus, this event is never raised.
Occurs when the user releases a key while the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control has focus.
Because a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control cannot get focus, this event is never raised.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control with the mouse.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> control with the mouse.
Occurs when the user presses a mouse button while the mouse pointer is over the control.
Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the control.
Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the control.
Occurs when the user moves the mouse pointer over the control.
Occurs when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse pointer is over the control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.FontChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Processes a mnemonic character.
The character to process.
`true` if the character was processed as a mnemonic by the control; otherwise, `false`.
Scales the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref> by the specified factor and scaling instruction.
If the control is top level, this method will not scale the control's location.
This method does not scale children or the size of automatically sized controls.
You can omit scaling in any direction by changing the value of the `specified` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.SizeF"></xref> that indicates the height and width of the scaled control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified"></xref> values that indicates how the control should be scaled.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can press the TAB key to give the focus to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref>.
Although you can set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.TabStop%2A> property to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> control cannot receive focus.
`true` to allow the user to press the TAB key to give the focus to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox.TabStop"></xref> property changes.
Gets or sets the text associated with this control.
The text associated with this control.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, if any.
This method should not be overridden.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, if any, or `null` if the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> is unnamed.

Gets or sets a value that determines whether to use the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> class ([!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)]) or the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer"></xref> class ([!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)]) to render text

The `UseCompatibleTextRendering` property is intended to provide visual compatibility between Windows Forms controls that render text using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> class and [!INCLUDE[net_v10_short](~/includes/net-v10-short-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[net_v11_short](~/includes/net-v11-short-md.md)] applications that perform custom text rendering using the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class.

In most cases, if your application is not being upgraded from [!INCLUDE[net_v10_short](~/includes/net-v10-short-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[net_v11_short](~/includes/net-v11-short-md.md)], it is recommended that you leave `UseCompatibleTextRendering` set to the default value of `false`.

The [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] based <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> class was introduced in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] to improve performance, make text look better, and improve support for international fonts.

In earlier versions of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] based <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class was used to perform all text rendering.
[!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] calculates character spacing and word wrapping differently from [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)].

In a Windows Forms application that uses the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class to render text, this could cause the text for controls that use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> to appear different from the other text in the application.
To resolve this incompatibility, you can set the `UseCompatibleTextRendering` property to `true` for a specific control.

To set `UseCompatibleTextRendering` to `true` for all supported controls in the application, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.SetCompatibleTextRenderingDefault%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method with a parameter of `true`.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> class should be used to perform text rendering for compatibility with versions 1.0 and 1.1.
of the .NET Framework; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Processes Windows messages.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
